get.description: Health check endpoint.

post.description:
Login endpoint - authenticate user and return JWT token.

Args:
    login_data: Username and password
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    JWT access token with metadata
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: 401 if credentials are invalid

Refresh access token using a valid refresh token.

Args:
    refresh_data: Refresh token
    db: Database session
    
Returns:
    New access token and refresh token
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: 401 if refresh token is invalid or expired

get.description:
Get current user's profile information.

Args:
    current_user: Current authenticated user from token
    
Returns:
    User profile data

post.description:
Create a new user (admin only).

Admins can create new employee accounts with specified roles.

get.description:
List all users (admin only).

Returns paginated list of users with optional filtering by active status.

Get current user's profile.

Any authenticated user can access their own profile.

patch.description:
Update current user's profile.

Users can update their own email, full name, and password.
Role fields cannot be modified through this endpoint.

get.description: Get a specific user by ID (admin only).

patch.description:
Update user information (admin only).

Allows updating username, email, full name, and status flags.

delete.description:
Soft delete a user (admin only).

User will be marked as deleted but data is preserved.
Admins cannot delete their own account.

patch.description:
Update user's role/permissions (admin only).

Allows promoting/demoting users to manager or admin roles.

post.description:
Activate a user account (admin only).

Sets is_active to True, allowing the user to log in.

Deactivate a user account (admin only).

Sets is_active to False, preventing the user from logging in.

Reset a user's password (admin only).

Admin can reset any user's password without knowing the current password.

Create a new customer.

Requires authentication.

Optionally filter by search query.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search by name, contact, or email
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search by name, contact, or email

get.description: Get a specific customer by ID.

patch.description:
Update a customer.

Only provided fields will be updated.

delete.description:
Soft delete a customer.

Requires manager or admin privileges.

Validation: Cannot delete a customer if they have associated jobs.
This ensures referential integrity and prevents orphaned job records.

post.description:
Create a new supplier.

Requires authentication.

get.description:
List all suppliers with pagination.

Optionally filter by search query.

Get all active suppliers (for dropdown/selection).

Returns all suppliers without pagination.

patch.description:
Update a supplier.

delete.description:

post.description:

Requires authentication.

schema.title: Response Get All Brands Api V1 Brands All Get

get.description: Get a specific brand by ID.

patch.description:
Update a brand.

Only provided fields will be updated.

delete.description:

Requires manager or admin privileges.

post.description:
Create a new job.

Requires authentication.

get.description:
List all jobs with pagination.

Optionally filter by status, customer, or search query.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search by job number or notes
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search by job number or notes

get.description: Get a specific job by ID.

patch.description:
Update a job.

Only provided fields will be updated.

delete.description:
Soft delete a job.

Requires manager or admin privileges.

post.description:
Update job status with validation.

This endpoint validates status transitions and updates lifecycle timestamps.

Add a delay to a job.

This endpoint records the delay reason and updates the estimated delivery date.
Sends a notification to the customer about the delay.

Requires manager or admin privileges.
Manually recalculate pricing for a job based on current watch and complaints. **Manager+ access.**

Create a new watch and attach to a job.

A job can only have one watch (one-to-one relationship).
Requires authentication.

get.description:
List all watches with pagination.

Optionally filter by brand or search query.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search by model or serial number
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search by model or serial number

get.description: Get a specific watch by ID.

patch.description:
Update a watch.

Only provided fields will be updated.

delete.description:
Soft delete a watch.

Requires manager or admin privileges.

get.description:
Get the watch for a specific job.

Since job-watch is one-to-one, returns a single watch or 404.

post.description:
Create a new indent (parts order from supplier).

Business Logic:
- Serial number is auto-generated (IND-YYYY-NNNN)
- Job ID is required
- Automatically updates job status to "indented" (if currently "booked")
- Validates job exists and is not completed/delivered/cancelled
- Validates supplier exists (if provided)

Requires authentication.

get.description:
List all indents with pagination.

Optionally filter by job or supplier.

Get a specific indent by ID (without parts).

For indent with parts list, use GET /indents/{indent_id}/with-parts

patch.description:
Update an indent.

Only provided fields will be updated.
Validates supplier and job if being changed.

Note: Changing job_id is rare and should be done carefully.

delete.description:
Soft delete an indent.

Note: This does NOT automatically revert the job status.
If needed, update the job status separately.

Requires manager or admin privileges.

get.description:
Get a specific indent by ID with all associated parts.

Returns indent with nested parts list for easier frontend consumption.
Includes spare part details (name, part number, description, unit price).

post.description:
Create a new spare part in the catalog.

Spare parts are reusable catalog items (like products).
They can be linked to multiple indents via the indent_parts junction table.

Requires authentication.

get.description:
List all spare parts in the catalog with pagination.

Optionally search by part name, part number, or description.
Spare parts are global catalog items, not indent-specific.

parameters.name: search

schema.description: Search by part name, part number, or description
schema.title: Search

parameters.description: Search by part name, part number, or description

get.description:
Get all active spare parts for dropdown/selection (no pagination).

Useful for UI dropdowns when adding parts to indents.

get.description: Get a specific spare part by ID.

patch.description:
Update a spare part in the catalog.

Only provided fields will be updated.
Validates that new part_name or part_number don't conflict with existing parts.

delete.description:
Soft delete a spare part.

Requires manager or admin privileges.

post.description:
Add a spare part to an indent.

If the part is already in the indent, the quantity will be increased.
Requires authentication.

get.description: List all spare parts in an indent.

schema.title: Response List Indent Parts Api V1 Indents  Indent Id  Parts Get

patch.description: Update the quantity of a spare part in an indent.

delete.description:
Remove a spare part from an indent.

Requires manager or admin privileges.

get.description:
Global search across multiple entity types.

**Search Entities:**
- `customer`: Search by name, contact, email, address, city
- `job`: Search by job number, notes, customer name, brand name
- `watch`: Search by model, serial number, brand, remarks
- `supplier`: Search by name, contact, email, address
- `brand`: Search by name, description

**Examples:**
- `/search?q=rolex` - Search all entities for "rolex"
- `/search?q=john&entities=customer,job` - Search customers and jobs for "john"
- `/search?q=JOB-2024&sort_by=date` - Search for jobs, sort by date

**Response:**
Returns paginated results with entity type, title, subtitle, description, and relevance score.

parameters.name: entities

schema.description: Comma-separated entity types (customer,job,watch,supplier,brand). If not provided, searches all.
schema.title: Entities

parameters.description: Comma-separated entity types (customer,job,watch,supplier,brand). If not provided, searches all.

post.description:
Generate date-wise report (Excel download).

Returns an Excel (.xlsx) file with formatted data.

Requires manager+ permission.

**Report Types:**
- `pending_repair`: All jobs not yet completed (no date range needed)
- `repair_status`: All jobs within date range with status
- `indent_status`: All indents within date range
- `delivered`: All delivered jobs within date range

**Date Format in Excel:** DD/MM/YYYY

**Response:** Excel file download with filename pattern:
- pending_repair_DD-MM-YYYY.xlsx
- repair_status_DD-MM-YYYY_to_DD-MM-YYYY.xlsx
- indent_status_DD-MM-YYYY_to_DD-MM-YYYY.xlsx
- delivered_DD-MM-YYYY_to_DD-MM-YYYY.xlsx

Generate delay report (Excel download).

Returns an Excel (.xlsx) file with color-coded delayed jobs.

Shows jobs delayed beyond the specified threshold (default: 15 days).

**Color Coding:**
- **Yellow background**: 15-30 days delayed
- **Red background**: >30 days delayed

Requires manager+ permission.

**Date Format in Excel:** DD/MM/YYYY

**Response:** Excel file download with filename pattern:
- delay_report_15days_DD-MM-YYYY.xlsx

200.description: Excel file download with color-coded delayed jobs
